results.title: We call it paradise
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence
results.brief_description: Niree Creed presents this portrait of Garden Island, 6 km. south of Perth and the effect the construction of HMAS Stirling, a naval base, has had on the island and on the town of Rockingham. The construction of the base caused some controversy as squatters, who had lived there for many years, were removed in the process. This film, produced by Defence Public Relations emphasises the benefits the base has brought to the local community.

results.title: The Bristol school
results.creator_credit: Nancy Hamilton, E.J. Perry and Victoria. Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description:
A look at the Victorian Department of Education’s work in importing 100 pressed aluminium building from Bristol, England. These buildings can be erected in 2 days and will provide accommodation of 8,000 students in an attempt to overcome overcrowding within Victorian schools.

The construction process is shown with one being assembled in the Melbourne University grounds near the Melbourne Teacher’s College.

The film print from which the digital copy was made was badly damaged and the digital version shows evidence of that.

results.title: Making the most of the micro 6-10
results.brief_description: Sequel to Parts 1-5 of the same title. Part 6: “Getting down to business” examines the pros and cons of system design and the role of expert advice from commercial software houses. 7: “Sounds interesting” addresses the micro making sounds and music. 8: “Everything under control” discusses the micro controlling equipment. 9: “Moving pictures”. 10: “At the end of the line” is about telephones and micros.

results.title: The Bowater story
results.creator_credit: Arthur Graham, Bowater and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: A story of industrial growth and enterprise - in 1926 the British company Bowater began making paper as well as selling it, and now owns mills and forests in many parts of the world including Norway, Sweden, USA, France, New Zealand and Australia.

results.title: Joan Sutherland in concert
results.creator_credit: Phillip Booth, Brian J Smith, TVW Enterprises and Western Australian Opera Company
results.brief_description: Dame Joan Sutherland, “La Stupenda”, accompanied by her husband/arranger and renowned pianist, Richard Bonynge, gives an outstanding performance with a program that is rich and varied from the dramatic to the light-hearted. This full-length recital was recorded at the Perth Concert Hall on 9 March 1982 for television.

results.title: No Fixed Address: on tour
results.creator_credit: Colin South, John Tatoulis, Channel 0-28 and Media World Productions
results.brief_description: Documentary on the British tour of one of Australia’s leading rock bands, No Fixed Address, a band committed to expressing aspects of their culture and the condition of Aboriginal people through their music. Includes footage of the Brisbane Commonwealth Games protests and also examines British black music.

results.title: Distance Running
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coaching and Training for Track and Field Events”.
Coaching tips for distance running events from Olympic athletes and coaches, plus footage of distance events from the Moscow Olympics.
